paper_id: Improving disk failure detection accuracy via data augmentation

triples.evidence: The disk failures affect the availability of cloud storage system and hurt the quality of service (QoS).

The SMART (detailed in Section II-A) is short for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology, which is widely implemented by manufacturers to monitor the health status of hard-disk-drives (HDD) and solid-state-drives (SSD).

Experimental results on real-world datasets show that, through data augmentation, MSGMD can improve the FDR and F1-Score of the state-of-the-art disk failure detection model by 31.59% and 30.74% respectively on average.

Experimental results on real-world datasets show that, through data augmentation, MSGMD can improve the FDR and F1-Score of the state-of-the-art disk failure detection model by 31.59% and 30.74% respectively on average.

mappings.label: Datacenter
mappings.notes: The paper discusses disk failures in cloud data centers.

mappings.label: SMARTAttribute
mappings.notes: The paper discusses SMART attributes for monitoring SSD health.

mappings.label: FDR
mappings.notes: FDR is a performance metric related to failure detection rate.

mappings.label: F1-Score
mappings.notes: F1-Score is a performance metric related to the balance between precision and recall.
